website_summaries.verdict: A good marine-use refractometer alternative that helps maintain salt water for marine life.
pros: Designed for use with at-home aquariums that require special attention
The overall profile is small and sensitive enough to keep around the house when not in use
cons: Can produce inaccurate readings when compared to a traditional hydrometer
Difficult to use with prescription eyeglasses

customer_reviews.title: Buy the calibration fluid with this!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to buy the calibration solution and test this before use! When I recieved it, I tested it with distilled water and it seemed dead on, yet my salinity readings in my aquarium seemed way too high from what I anticipated them being. So I purchsed the calibration test fluid and it showed the refractometer needed a definate adjustment. Once I adjusted the refractometer, my aquarium salinity read 1.026 as expected. I had it independently tested also and the refractometer now reads dead on with the verified test. Now that it's calibrated I love it!
customer_reviews.author: mom2three

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, accurate readings and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and simple to use refractometer. Be sure to adjust the focus by turning the eye focal when you first receive. (best seen under bright light conditions) I would suggest purchasing the salt calibration solution. (well worth it) Looks to provide very accurate readings. Save yourself a lot of money and buy it here on Amazon for only $20, don't buy it from your local pet store for $30 or more as you will most likely receive the same exact product manufactured in the same exact factory and country just rebranded under a different label.
customer_reviews.author: 911 Turbo Man

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it’s adjusted properly or your reading will be off
customer_reviews.text: Now this is great but you still need to buy an instant ocean hydrometer to make sure your readings match. The instant ocean hydrometer will always be right . Make sure to knock out the bubbles on the white dial by hitting it with your knuckle. So once your instant ocean shows a measurement. Compare it with the refractometer and adjust the refractometer so that it matches.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I just got my refractor. It came with all that was listed in the in production description. Next I calibrated the refractor with the calibration solution that I ordered too. The refractor was off out off the box. The initial reading was 1.024 with the calibration solution. Adjusted the refractor to the 1.026 for calibration fluid. Next tested my water. The water was at what I expected it should be. This refractor should last a good number of years. It is heavy and easy to read in any light. I would recommend this product to anyone that has a marine aquarium. I will update later to see if the refractor will keep its calibration.
customer_reviews.author: kdogg300

customer_reviews.title: Like it more than my Hydrometer
customer_reviews.text: It works. Just be sure to follow the directions on the calibrating solution for SALTWATER tanks. If you read the directions in the box for the refractometer it’s for freshwater.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust this even if you have calibration solution.
customer_reviews.text: Completely unreliable for reading salinity in a reef tank. I’ve calibrated this thing 3-4 times using a calibration solution. It reads 0.010 higher then the actual lever which lead to the slow drop of salinity in my tank until I was nearing a tank crash. I’m still not sure if two of my hammers are going to pull though. One was a golden hammer that has been a dream coral of mine. And now my dreams are shriveled and dying, along with my anemone...
customer_reviews.author: AV19

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use - good value
customer_reviews.text: Aquarium store folks indicated that this type of product was more accurate than the older plastic salinity tester. We purchased the model which is much less expensive than the high end version based on reviews and it seems to work great. It did not need adjusting to calibrate, though I tried to just to see how it worked. Very easy, turn screw very slowly to calibrate. Ultimately, the measurement was exactly the same as our old tester. Guess we did not really need it, but good to know the reading is consistent and now we have a backup with the old one.
customer_reviews.author: LKTAR

customer_reviews.title: Great refractometer
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely a good refractometer. It is clear and easy to read and stays calibrated once you set it but you do have to make sure and calibrate it before using it. I recommend buying some calibration fluid. The readings were off at first but it’s easy enough to adjust with the tools that come with it. Comes with a nice hard case and some handy droppers.
customer_reviews.author: Lagoon

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Whatever you do, stay away from this product. I used a calibration fluid, and even then, this refractometer wasn’t reading 1.02 until I doubled the amount of salt that the package of salt recommended. I trusted the tool, and when I added my first coral frags, they all died immediately. I took a water sample to my LFS and the salinity was so high their digital refractometer couldnt even give it a value. Save your time and pick up a digital version, because all the dropping water on the surface and looking into the light takes so much longer and twice the amount of effort for something you’ll be using frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Lightweight Unit with Drifting Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I've owned many refractometers and this one is poor. Calibration drifts even if you handle it with kid gloves. Super light weight and cheap feeling compared to aluminum alloy models. You get what you pay for. My advice is spend $59 and get a Sybon.
customer_reviews.author: JoeJ

customer_reviews.title: May not be accurate?
customer_reviews.text: I’m not too sure know about the accuracy of this thing, i bought a little gauge to keep in my tank so i can see nightly at a glance where i’m at and it’s WAYYYYY higher than this thing has been reading?? The directions say to calibrate with distilled or RO water which i always do?? Now i have trust issues!!! 😭 Maybe will try calibration solution, or maybe just spend the money on a better one??? Idk.. :/
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice refractometer!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as tested against a known instrument. Calibrated and accurate right out of the box. I am one of those old-school guys who loves the floating hydrometer. Not always possible to use one -- there's not always enough water. Loving this new tool because all I need is two drops of water. Very easy now to make sure salinity is right before releasing new animals into my tank.
customer_reviews.author: Sal Serafino

customer_reviews.title: Almost killed all my pond plants
customer_reviews.text: Salinity meter? I have 3,800 gallon pond with koi and plants. The nitrite got very high and I needed to add salt for the sake of the fish. I did this incrementally over a week, but the meter barely recorded and change in the salinity. AFTER 40 POUNDS OF SALT! Noticed the leaves browning and curling and bought a digital meter to measure. 0.3%!!! No wonder the plants were affected. Now a water change.
customer_reviews.author: bargain hunter

customer_reviews.title: Accruate once calibrated
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and accurate once calibrated. Forget the calibration fluid, just use RO water and let it get to room temp, check and use the screwdriver to adjust to 0. Then you're basically good, but I would calibrate weekly just in case. Solid build and easy to use. Price is insanely good for what you get. Hint: you should always check salinity at the same temperature as your calibration RO, I know the refractometer says it can adjust to temperatures, but it can't do it well. Be accurate and measure the salinity at consistent temps.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay calibrated!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one and returned it for not holding calibration. The second one arrived and again it would not stay calibrated. My readings were way off. I have one exactly like this from LFS same brand and everything, works fine. The two I ordered from amazon were bad. Also the interior blue is very dark making a bad situation worse. The picture shows a much lighter blue. My LFS one is the lighter blue. I wonder if these are knock-offs?
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Came perfectly calibrated, easy to read and really clear instructions. I really liked that it includes pipettes, a cleaning cloth, a screwdriver for calibration and a sturdy case so you have everything you need to maintain the life and accuracy of the refractometer. Seems like a really good quality product and at a really awesome price for anybody wanting to start a saltwater tank spend the extra ten bucks and get one of these and not a swing arm tester these are more accurate and last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and calibrate
customer_reviews.text: VERY easy to calibrate using RO (reverse osmosis) water. This is my second refractometer. I gave the first away and then decided to keep my tank up. Anyway, these are very accurate at measuring salinity for your salt or brackish water aquarium. I dont use anything else. There are new digital ones out but they are 75$ - not shelling out that much money for the latest gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Product
customer_reviews.text: Product itself is heavy duty, strong, and accurate. Focus lenses for your liking. Definitely recommend buying the calibration fluid!! Will help keep it as accurate as possible. Came with the case, meter, tube for water droplets, and wipe for glass. I love this to test my brackish water! 10/10 would recommend this over the standard ones that go in the water!
customer_reviews.author: NAMEUNKNOWN

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to test salinity in a brackish tank, so I didn't need absolutely accurate numbers. I haven't used the digital ones, so I don't know how accurate/inaccurate it is compared to those. But for my needs it worked out perfectly. Just add a couple drops and look through it. Simple enough.
customer_reviews.author: Enigma4youTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Love this device
customer_reviews.text: Amazon how much cheaper it is here compared to stores, the stores were trying to charge me 80 dollars! Make sure to calibrate prior so your readings are accurate and also double test with Hydrometer to confirm. I would give 5 stars if it was a bit easier to read, but it can also be my eyes. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nardo Family

customer_reviews.title: I was getting unexpected readings so I took this to ...
customer_reviews.text: I was getting unexpected readings so I took this to my LFS. They got different results than me with both my hydrometer and this refractrometer. Got out the calibration fluid - turns out this was spot on dead accurate above all three types of measuring devices - and multiple refractrometers!
customer_reviews.author: ColinP

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap build with lint in optics and left scale reads 1.024 while right scale is 32-33
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate enough for reef tank. I trusted it for a month then it needed calibrated constantly and then I realized scales not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Sum Ting Wong

customer_reviews.title: Works but rusts quickly
customer_reviews.text: So it was perfect at first but after a few months now, the tiny screws have rusted out and so it doesn’t close the plastic clear cover. This makes getting an accurate reading a real pain. Maybe they’ll fix it? Also, you need to make sure you calibrate it first before using which is extra $. (Calibration fluid). Or I guess you can use RODI water and set it to 0?
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for short time. Now collects dust
customer_reviews.text: This works well for a few months the the hinge to the lid no longer moved well, making it hard to close tight. I’m back to using my 10 year old one.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and accurite.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my reef aquarium to test the waters salinity. Very easily shows when in the range needed for a quality water and salt mix. Calibration was simple. Ready to go unit within 5 minutes.....will purchase again if this one gets broken.
customer_reviews.author: Milton M.

customer_reviews.title: RefractAWESOMEr
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is great. Who needs an expensive digital salinity device when you can have a SCIENCE EXPERIMENT. There’s no better feeling than watching the water spread evenly under the daylight plate, getting down on one knee, and pointing this telescopic ingenuity to the sky and realizing you have a 1.023 specific gravity! Woo. My fishes are happy and recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I calibrated it with distilled water and then checked my saltwater aquarium with it. I got the same reading as the aquarium store that tested it earlier. That confirms that I am in the right range. I think this is a good product for the money. Comes with a nice quality Case to protect it
customer_reviews.author: Mr David

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate enough
customer_reviews.text: This meter can basically tell you if you have salty water or not. It is not accurate enough to help determine the difference between 5% and 10% salt water solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Sammie B.

customer_reviews.title: Imposible to calibrate
customer_reviews.text: This is a toy. I don't recommend this refractometer if you are serious about skipping your reef aquarium in optimal conditions. This refractometer is impossible to calibrate; at one point, the calibration screw was off, and still, the reading was under the right levels.
customer_reviews.author: Armando L.

customer_reviews.title: Allows quick check of aquarium Salinity
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Instructions should include information on adjusting eyepeice to get a good focus. Recommend purchasing calibration solution, as when calibrated with distilled water, I had inaccurate results. Purchased calibration solution and now readings are accurate and as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Thayne Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but get calibration fluid
customer_reviews.text: This works great! It comes in a nice case and comes with two pipets and a small screw driver to calibrate it. You need to buy calibration fluid in my opinion. I tried using distilled water like recommended for making saltwater for my aquarium at 1.026, but it was actually around 1.017. I bought calibration fluid and easily calibrated it and now I couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Dailyn Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is decently priced. Checked with distilled water and it was perfectly at zero and the I calibrated it with Two Little Fishies Accurasea and it's reading dead on the money. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Devin W

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This refractometer is a great product. The one I received did need to be calibrated out of the box; however, it has held a perfect calibration ever since. I have used it every other day for the past month for my reef tank and QT, and it has been spot on. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and read. I went through the set up with the buffer solution to calibrate. My unit was already set and did not require adjustment. This is a must have if you want to check your salinity. Can’t beat the price
customer_reviews.author: Raymond keith snow

customer_reviews.title: Can't calibrate
customer_reviews.text: By the point that I get close to calibrating it, the screw comes out. It's not possible to calibrate. The "white" will never get high enough to line up at 0...with pure distilled water. The lens/prism or something is set incorrectly inside the unit. I can't fix that. However, at this point, it is too late for me to return it. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect working great make sure you get the calibration fluid this is a must I have rechecked it after a couple of days and I’m very happy with the outcome still right on the money
customer_reviews.author: David Vogelfanger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for salinity checks, highly accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate after you calibrated with distilled water. I would definitely recommend this product. Especially for the price it can’t be beat. Comes with two plastic dropper’s and a case to keep it safe.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This refractometer works great. I bought some calibration fluid for it, calibrated it, and then tested my 5 gallons of water that I had just added salt to based on weight. The refractometer gave me the exact reading I was expecting based on the amount of salt I added. It also came with some pipettes and a microfiber cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It is cheap. works well to keep salinity in saltwater stable. Not sure if its perfectly accurate it is. But it seems to read consistently, which is the main thing I care about.
customer_reviews.author: D. White

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Mine did not come calibrated but it was easy to calibrate and use. Came with all the needed tools, though the screwdriver was too small and I had to use one from my toolset instead. Easy to read the numbers, just make sure you point toward a bright light. I’m very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: brajansantiago

customer_reviews.title: Salinity tester
customer_reviews.text: Overall it gets the job done I wipe mine clean after every use seems to be calibrated I still purchase the calibration liquid it was off just a bit comes with the tool to calibrate it I will recommend for the price and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Bimmer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: We had a powder blue Tang get ich. Our quarantine systems salinity must have been too high, our tang did not make it. I bought this and found it to make more accurate measurements than the plastic one that you fill with water to get your measurement. Since then I have not had a fish with ich in a quantity that requires a quarantine but I am certain, if it were to happen, that I am much better equipped to handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Megan St. Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Really dig it was using the same refractometer since 2013 it was way off I compare this one to my Hanna salinity reader and with 35 PPT calibration solution it's spot-on
customer_reviews.author: mrcycs805

customer_reviews.title: Not for Salt pool use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but not suitable for salt pool measurement. The scale is too low to red salt pool accurately. Came calibrated a bit high, purchased calibration fluid and lowered it to 35ppt (39ppt out of the box). My pool salt is roughly 4000ppm, this was so close to the bottom of the scale it was unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Heffernan

customer_reviews.title: Works after calibrated, but cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: It works for what it is. It did need to be calibrated with a quality solution, but worked fine afterwards. Gave 2 stars because of the cheap material and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No problems, great quality and highly accurate
customer_reviews.text: No problems and great quality as the title says. Wish I didn't spend $10 to verify this by buying "calibration fluid" because mine came perfectly calibrated but with our saltwater tanks better safe than sorry! Thumbs Up - 5 Star Product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the one I got is defective, but I think it’s highly overrated. I get similar readings from the instant ocean hydrometer and other salinity checkers and something totally different with the refractometer even after calibration. I calibrate every time I use it and still it’s inaccurate. Without calibration, it’s worse.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: You will never go back to using a hydrometer with this refractometer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this refractometer for several months now and I have compared it with others. Seem to have the same build as the higher end refractometers and a quality you can feel. Works like a standard refractoemeter and I would definitely recommend this to all reefers, time to get rid of your old hydrometer!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Cheap ,easy to use and did I already say cheap??
customer_reviews.text: Went to my LFS to buy a refractometer and the guy said he had one for 50 bux. Good thing I didnt buy it cuz this one was 19 bux. All u need is calibrating liquid and ur golden! Spent 6 bux for the liquid, calibrated my new refractometer and bam !! I'm now measuring my salinity like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Agustin Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Its good but...
customer_reviews.text: It is not calibrated when it is shipped. Get some calibration fluid and calibrate it. Calibrate it every time you use it. Mine can drift quite a bit and that's with mixing water every 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Riley M.

customer_reviews.title: You really need this product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been meaning to get one of these for a long time. I’ve been using a hydrometer and they’re just not as accurate for aquarium saltwater. This thing saves me a lot of time and worry because it’s so accurate.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a saltwater aquarium this is a must. The other salinity meters were a hassle. I love the simplicity and value for money. Local aquarium had this for $45
customer_reviews.author: Gautam

customer_reviews.title: good for frugal aquarists who still want trustworthy results
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap but it actually works pretty well! If you're patient enough to use this, it could save you quite a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Works Great For Me
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality refractometer. Have been using it regularly for a couple of months now and no complaints. Arrived calibrated and has stayed calibrated. I'm no professional in the use of refractometers by any means however, if you're new into Reef or saltwater aquariums I highly recommend this over a hydrometer.
customer_reviews.author: Nevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Great refractometer, so-so storage case.
customer_reviews.text: This refractometer works great. It's so much more accurate than a hydrometer. My only complaint is that I wish the case was 1/4 inch longer, so I can adjust the focus to fit my vision and leave it set, It's not that big of a deal, but the previous ones I've owned all came with cases that you can set it and forget it..
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Skip the cheap plastic ones
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money- this is a good method of checking salinity for a saltwater aquarium. I would recommend getting some calibration fluid to ensure it’s accuracy both when you get it and periodically in between uses for that extra piece of mind. Skip the cheap plastic ones and get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate salinity tester
customer_reviews.text: I have a saltwater aquarium and I use this refractometer to test the water salinity nearly every day. It is easy to use and callibrate. I use it when making new saltwater and to test my aquarium water so I know when I need to add new freshwater to replace what has evaporated. I don't know what I'd do without it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wight

customer_reviews.title: Great but check calibration first
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use. They do say its calibrated from the factory but I found mine to be about 3ppt off out of the box. Highly suggest getting calibration fluid with it
customer_reviews.author: SaltwaterTony

customer_reviews.title: Calibrate first
customer_reviews.text: Calibrate your refractometer when you get it and it will work perfect. I calibrated mine and then had my LFS check my salinity against what I was reading and it was spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Wehmann

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend to use since the ones we looked at at our local store was super expensive. I love that it comes in a case to keep everything together and protected. My boyfriend is very happy with this purchase and has recommended it to his friends as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Use on saltwater tank
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and has a nice case to store in. Use this weekly when changing water in our tank.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: The hinge on the top glass rusted and now won’t read properly. Of course dried every time I used it, but only got 2 months out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool for my reef tank!
customer_reviews.text: Had to calibrate it out of the box but that’s to be expected. Who doesn’t calibrate things??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great accessories and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Love all the little tools and accessories it comes with and the case is great!! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michele C

customer_reviews.title: Gives me confidence
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a quality instrument. Good, clear, complete instructions. I’m pleased.
customer_reviews.author: David Van De Voort

customer_reviews.title: Use your phone camera and take a picture make more easily for Read
customer_reviews.text: I love but only complaint is, you need to use on a bright room or directly on a light
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Delivery driver threw it over my fence
customer_reviews.text: I found the package on my patio near my fence. Inside the bag the refractometer box was open and the contents were loose. Nothing appears to be broken. I tested it and it seems okay.
customer_reviews.author: Blane M Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect. Perfect price.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hydrometer I wasted 15 dollars on at petsmart. Totally inaccurate. Wasted lots of water and salt trying to get 1.024. This refractometer works perfect. Can calibrate it with the included screw driver. New saltwater aquarium people buy this. Don't waste money on a hydrometer. - Richard
customer_reviews.author: Richard - Fort Worth,TX

customer_reviews.title: Works as described!!
customer_reviews.text: Watched the video on how to properly use item and no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: HamDude

customer_reviews.title: Get away from strips and test tubes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this for my new saltwater tank. I've got all the test tubes and droppers,but this refractor is so simple and quick to use. Measurements have been accurate and the results are easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Sara W

customer_reviews.title: Must have for saltwater aquariums
customer_reviews.text: Works great, so much more accurate than the old plastic dip ones
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, why didn't I buy one before?
customer_reviews.text: Too easy! Get this and you'll feel much better about your testing. Too easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P. Frantz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, great price
customer_reviews.text: As advertised and on time. It was properly calibrated out of the box. A lot easier to use than the swinging arm hygrometer
customer_reviews.author: Tango Fox

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time and it works great. My saltwater tank is very healthy
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and some calibration fluid but it's useless because the line is below 0 and the calibration screw doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Tested it with some distilled water as outlined. Its spot on out of the box. I have to say the case it comes in is very nice, The inside protective material makes it feel much more expensive than it was. The refractometer itself is heavy and doesn't feel cheep at all. Very happy with this product and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Phingirlmeg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product get it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect item came precalibratred but still check to be sure just use a calibration fluid if you have it, if not then use 100% distilled water. Definitely much more accurate than those leave in tank float testers by a long shot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: Did the job. I did calibrate, adjusted the focus, and had to find a good light source. After that I could see the reading fairly well. I was surprised because I were glasses for both far sight and reading but was still able to make out the reading.
customer_reviews.author: DHB

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Numbers are too small, focus lens is annoying and unnecessary and hard to calibrate perfectly, find my self using a hydrometer to measure my tanks water for half the price and a more accurate reading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires calibration everytime you use it.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know if mine was dropped diring shipping or what happened. However this refractometer will not hold calibration for even a day. I have to calibrate it before i use it every single time. It wont even hold for 2 hours. I will set if with calibration fluid, and then 2-3 hours later it will be as much as 2-3 points off.
customer_reviews.author: Juka

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Other items were hard to work. This is easy and accurate. Simple to use. Good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good price bought 2
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price and better than a cheap hydrometer
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very great product. It is easy to use and comes ...
customer_reviews.text: Very great product. It is easy to use and comes calibrated right out of the box. This is such a great tool at a very good low price. No problems what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great for such an affordable device
customer_reviews.text: Works great for such an affordable device! Wish the scale was more sensitive for fresh water use (I'm using it to measure .3 for a koi pond parasite issue) so it's hard to be accurate at those low levels, but it's doable if you have good eyes. Verified results with a water test at my local pool dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Carey

customer_reviews.title: Re-calibrate before using
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but the reading on this out of the box was 15 psu too high. I guess it's on me for not testing it with RODI water before using it, but the instructions said it had been already calibrated so I didn't. Good thing I realized before I killed all my corals. Actual instrument is fine, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: It works well but very hard to read!!
customer_reviews.text: Calibrated this tool before using for the first time, appears to be accurate and it will be same measurement 10/10 times. The Consistency is very good! Would buy again if need be.
customer_reviews.author: mark palazzolo

customer_reviews.title: Saved my fish
customer_reviews.text: Never trust buoyancy spg meters. They killed many fish before I finally figured out what was wrong. This product is first and foremost highly accurate, easy to use and will keep your fish alive with water changes.
customer_reviews.author: Donald K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, needed a very small calibration and has been flawless since, confirmed with LFS.

customer_reviews.title: Broke ...while calibrating...too late to return.
customer_reviews.text: More along the lines of a kiddie toy than an scientific instrument. Very cheaply made and the instructions are, shall we say, interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Don Bloss

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult to read
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied. My eyesight is such that I find it a little difficult to read. It will take a little bit of experimentation to permit easy use.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Foran

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, calibrated on arrival. Has held calibration for the month or two I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Work really great i love it. It is clear for read your salt on your water easily. And it is less expensive them anywhere else
customer_reviews.author: Mathieu

customer_reviews.title: As described.
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for our new to us tank. we were shocked at how off the salinity was after using a more traditional hydrometer( i.o brand) . Easy to use and came with a dropper and instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Kaler

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after 6 month
customer_reviews.text: Got rusted after 6 month which makes it very hard to close the lid down. Have to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Huy Hoang

customer_reviews.title: 100x better than hydrometer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little tool very easy to use and calibrate and dead on salinity. Never trusting a hydrometer again
customer_reviews.author: Ethan weigel

customer_reviews.title: Still works
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time to check my tank, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: NCSUfan2013

customer_reviews.title: Purfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. I received it and it was calibrated pretty accurate, it was only off by 0.001sg using calibration fluid. This hopfully saved my corals I was using a swing arm before this and turns out my sg was at 1.031 yikes!
customer_reviews.author: CDtechy

customer_reviews.title: just buy it
customer_reviews.text: i love this thing, i dropped the old themometer style one i used for 20 years and i searched for a new one but i'm glad i couldn't find it because this one is so easy to use and more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: 64 worldsfair

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a calibrating solution, and it tested perfectly. Found if you put about five drops on the lens, and close the cover from back to front, it'll prevent air bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Britoni

customer_reviews.title: works great easy to read and adjust
customer_reviews.text: works great easy to read and adjust but the clip design on the box is cheep and on the wrong side of box it snapped of first time I opened it now I use a rubber banned to hold it shut.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

product_meta.title: Salinity Refractometer for Seawater and Marine Fishkeeping Aquarium 0-100 PPT with Automatic Temperature Compensation
feature_bullets: Measure salt water or salinity of water, ideal for aquariums and marine monitoring.
Measures on 2 scales, Specific Gravity (D 20/20) and parts per thousand.
Comes with hard case, dropper, screwdriver, user manual and cleaning cloth.
The main part is made of chromium, it's very durable.
